_header: Before that any creature was wrought / Or ere any beginning was of ought
Note: For MSS of the Pricke of Conscience see 1953, 5398, 5399.
Title(s): Speculum huius vite ; Pricke of Conscience
_description: Speculum huius vite (an abridged and altered text of the Pricke of Conscience) — in couplets

BodAddA268.First Lines:
Be fore þat any creature wos wroȝtOr er any begynnyng wos
                    of oȝtAnd be fore all tymes we sal troweþe same god wos
                    þat is now…
BodAddA268.Last Lines:
…To þe quych ioy he vs bryngþat made heuen &
                    erth & all thyng
BodAddA268.Note:
There are Latin quotations and subtitles inserted in the text of the
                    poem. Glosses in the margins identify references in the text; arabic numbers in
                    the margins highlight ennumerations in the text, i. e., 10 commandments on ff.
                        120v-121.

TCD155.First Lines:
Byfore þat any creature was wrouȝtor er any bygynnyng was
                    of ouȝt…
TCD155.Note: Ends imperfectly due to lost folios at end of volume.
